FAQ
What is My Sound Grid?

My Sound Grid is a client-side web application that allows you to make soundboards using your own sound files.

I have no idea what you just said. What does this let me do?

TL;DR: You can upload sound files and play them here.

Alright that sort of makes sense, but why would I need something like this? Why not just use iTunes, Spotify, or any of my music apps?

Because of the hassle! Imagine you have ten or twenty short sound clips (like say, the 'AND HIS NAME IS JOHN CENA' sound bite) that you want to play whenever you want. Do you really want to add a bunch of tiny sound files to your music library? Everything would be cluttered and maybe they'll play during a shuffle when you're playing music for your friends, family, or significant other. Talk about embarrassing, dude.

Good point. How do I add my own sound?

Click the pink "Add Sound Tile" button on top and add your file. Then press the play button.

Are there any restrictions on file size? File type?

There are no limits on file size (you can potentially upload hour-long sounds). Supported file types include .mp3, .ogg, and .wav.

How do I delete a sound?

Click on the sound tile's title and confirm the deletion on the window that pops up.

Does anything save? Are you secretely harvesting my sound files and data mining my usage?

Hell no, dude. I don't care about anything you do with this app. Absolutely nothing is being stored anywhere. Not even a cookie (go ahead and inspect the source code). All of your sound files are on your machine and I have no access to them.

Does this mean that nothing I do is saved when I leave the page and come back?

Yeah. Nothing you do is saved when you're using this online version. If you refresh the page or leave, it's gone.

What if I want to save my sound tiles for future use?

I'm working on an offline version that you can download. It will save all of your progress between sessions. This will be available around early April 2017.

What are some of the more specific uses of this app?

This app was originally created with the intention of providing a modern-looking, easy-to-use soundboard app for streamers, online radio stations, and other gigs where you'd want instant access to a bunch of random sounds.

Can I use this in my project or make my own spinoff?

Absolutely. All of the source code is on GitHub (see below). You're free to modify the code for your own uses, but I will request that you be a good sport and give me a mention.
